item.title: R.I.P 2006scape
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“xI c E, post:70, topic:477443”]From RL:

[quote]On the 3rd of January 2013, Vault has suddenly stopped the development of 2006Scape and took the website offline. Rumors say that a judge forced Vault to take 2006Scape offline after a lawsuit started by Jagex, but this information is false. Vault himself said he’s made the decision due to extensive legal advice he has received, but that also turned out to be a lie.

The 2006Scape project was sponsored by its (upcoming) players through means of donations. All donators/shareholders were promised a stable product (2006Scape) in return, but they’ve actually never received something in return. Instead, Vault seems to have disappeared with all the money and is now accused scamming. If you have made an investment in 2006Scape using PayPal and/or credit card, we advise you to chargeback the money.[/quote][/quote]

Its a lie.

Jagex did bring him down. Jagex publicly hinted at a lawsuit on the forums also. What the team is not going to tell you is that they were all offered jobs at Jagex in the very same email.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P 2006scape
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:

From RL:

On the 3rd of January 2013, Vault has suddenly stopped the development of 2006Scape and took the website offline. Rumors say that a judge forced Vault to take 2006Scape offline after a lawsuit started by Jagex, but this information is false. Vault himself said he's made the decision due to extensive legal advice he has received, but that also turned out to be a lie.

The 2006Scape project was sponsored by its (upcoming) players through means of donations. All donators/shareholders were promised a stable product (2006Scape) in return, but they’ve actually never received something in return. Instead, Vault seems to have disappeared with all the money and is now accused scamming. If you have made an investment in 2006Scape using PayPal and/or credit card, we advise you to chargeback the money.

Read full topic

[/quote]

item.title: R.I.P 2006scape
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:49, topic:477443”]Unless you’re making an entire game from scratch its impossible.

They can shut you down for one shred of their protocol, client, cache, website, sprites, armors, icons, minimaps, items etc.

Ill say again, you don’t understand it.

Server -> arguably illegal because it uses the protocol
Client -> 100% illegal on all grounds, no way around it.
Cache -> 100% illegal. Even if you rewrote your own client you can’t use their cache

So you have to make a whole new game.

And to add to that, making a game remotely similar to runescape is also grounds for a lawsuit. Even the IDEA is illegal to copy. Welcome to the wonderful world of opportunity where hard work is protected (oh no! :rolleyes:)[/quote]

Frell is pretty much spot on really, the client and cache as well as the website are intellectual property of Jagex, the protocol is a grey area though and we’re not really sure as to if or not legal action could be taken against it, I would say to be safe avoid distributing the cache and client (if you plan on hosting a server use external websites such as mopar list etc), and under no circumstances use the rs website; this is one of the reasons 2006scape were such an easy target.

Read full topic
